intro: Hansenia, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and consists of several species that are typically found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plants are characterized by their slender, upright stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Hansenia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique appearance and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. They are also known for their resilience to drought and high temperatures.
